post.description: Authenticate user with JSON body (email, password).

get.description: Lecturer or Admin: List all profiles (cookie auth).

Authenticated user: Get their own full profile (auto-refresh if expiring).

The auth dependency returns a minimal CurrentUser (id/email/role). We need to
fetch the persisted profile row to satisfy the full ProfileSchema contract.

put.description: Authenticated user: Update their own profile (cookie auth).

get.description: Lecturer or Admin: Get a public profile by ID (cookie auth).

put.description: Admin-only: Update a user's role (cookie auth).

post.description: Submit code and wait for completion before returning the result.
Execute code and return a normalized result without persistence.
Execute code without persistence and return stdout only.

post.summary: Execute with expected; returns stdout + success
Execute multiple submissions via batch API
post.description: Execute a batch and return a token-result mapping.

post.summary: Submit to Judge0 then poll Supabase for result

post.description: Submit code with authentication but without persisting the payload.

get.description: Fetch an execution result directly from Judge0 without persistence.

Return all published challenges for the given week as bundles (challenge + questions).

- plain (base) challenges return up to 5 questions (snapshot)
- other tiers return a single question per challenge

post.description: Submit a single question. Honors attempt limits and persists results to code_submissions/code_results.

post.summary: Submit a snapshot challenge (batch) - uses up to 5 snapshot questions
post.description:
Submit multiple questions according to the user's current open attempt snapshot.

The `submissions` body should be a mapping of question_id -> source_code.

schema.title: Response List Students Admin Panel Students Get

post.description:
Batch enroll students via either a JSON list or CSV file.
- If using CSV: provide file, module_id, and semester_id as query params.
- If using JSON: provide requests (list of EnrolmentCreate objects), no file needed.

get.description:
Returns student analytics (submissions, challenges, ELO/GPA) in chart-ready format.
Optional filters: module_id, start_date, end_date

student_number.title: Student Number
student_number.description: Optional 8-digit student number (if supplied, stored in auth user metadata and used by DB trigger as profile id)
